description: '''Dance-punk''' (also known as '''disco-punk''') is a [[post-punk]] subgenre that emerged in the late 1970s, and is closely associated with the [[disco]], [[post-disco]] and [[New wave music|new wave]] movements. The genre is characterized by mixing the energy of [[punk rock]] with the danceable rhythms of [[funk]] and [[disco]]. It was most prominent in the [[New York City]] punk movement.
